Module hu.unipannon.virt.plot
Package hu.unipannon.virt.plot.data

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.unipannon.virt.plot.data.Line
  • public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
    Data class to store a line as two arrays of double. This class handles the normalization and computation of the extremum points.
    Author:
    Tóth Bálint

    • Constructor Detail

      • Line

        public Line​(double[] xs,
            double[] ys,
            javafx.scene.paint.Paint color,
            double width,
            StrokeStyle style,
            Marker.MarkerType marker)
        Constructs a line data instance. xs and ys must be same size arrays.
        Parameters:
        xs - X coordinates of the line's points.
        ys - Y coordinates of the line's points.
        color - color of the line as JavaFX Paint.
        width - width of the line in points.
        style - style of the line.
        marker - marker of the line's data points.

    • Method Detail

      • setError

        public void setError​(boolean lines,
                     boolean area,
                     double[] low,
                     double[] up,
                     javafx.scene.paint.Paint color,
                     double width,
                     StrokeStyle style,
                     Marker.MarkerType marker,
                     javafx.scene.paint.Paint areaColor)
        Set error area parameters for the line. The error area will appear with the specified color and edge curves (lower and upper). The low and up arrays must be the same size as the line's xs and ys arrays specified in the constructor.
        Parameters:
        lines - if true the error area's edges will be shown as a line with the parameters specified below.
        area - if true the error area will be shown as a patch in the color given by areaColor.
        low - lower points of the error area (only Y coordinates, as X coordinates are given in the constructor).
        up - lower points of the error area (only Y coordinates, as X coordinates are given in the constructor).
        color - color of the edge lines as JavaFX Paint object.
        width - width of the edge lines in points.
        style - style of the edge lines.
        marker - markers for the edge lines. (Can be NONE.)
        areaColor - color of the error area as JavaFX Paint object.

      • isShowErrorLines

        public boolean isShowErrorLines()
        Query for the error line display.
        Returns:
        if the error lines are given TRUE in the setError function.

      • isShowErrorArea

        public boolean isShowErrorArea()
        Query for the error area display.
        Returns:
        if the error area is given TRUE in the setError function.

      • getLowerErrorNormal

        public double[] getLowerErrorNormal​(double min,
                                    double max)
        Query for the normalized Y coordinates of the lower error line.
        Parameters:
        min - absolute minimum value of the "display window".
        max - absolute maximum value of the "display window".
        Returns:
        array of screen-space normalized Y coordinates of the lower error line.

      • getUpperErrorNormal

        public double[] getUpperErrorNormal​(double min,
                                    double max)
        Query for the normalized Y coordinates of the upper error line.
        Parameters:
        min - absolute minimum value of the "display window".
        max - absolute maximum value of the "display window".
        Returns:
        array of screen-space normalized Y coordinates of the upper error line.

      • getNormalXs

        public double[] getNormalXs​(double min,
                            double max)
        Query for the normalized X coordinates of the contained line. This function will be used for the error lines' X coordinates.
        Parameters:
        min - absolute minimum value of the "display window".
        max - absolute maximum value of the "display window".
        Returns:
        array of screen-space normalized X coordinates of the line.

      • getNormalYs

        public double[] getNormalYs​(double min,
                            double max)
        Query for the normalized Y coordinates of the contained line.
        Parameters:
        min - absolute minimum value of the "display window".
        max - absolute maximum value of the "display window".
        Returns:
        array of screen-space normalized Y coordinates of the line.

      • getLogNormalXs

        public double[] getLogNormalXs​(double min,
                               double max,
                               int logBase)
        Query for the normalized X coordinates of the contained line that are already transformed into a logarithmic scale.
        Parameters:
        min - absolute minimum value of the "display window".
        max - absolute maximum value of the "display window".
        logBase - the base of the logarithm used for the X axis.
        Returns:
        array of screen-space normalized X coordinates of the line.

      • getLogNormalYs

        public double[] getLogNormalYs​(double min,
                               double max,
                               int logBase)
        Query for the normalized Y coordinates of the contained line that are already transformed into a logarithmic scale.
        Parameters:
        min - absolute minimum value of the "display window".
        max - absolute maximum value of the "display window".
        logBase - the base of the logarithm used for the Y axis.
        Returns:
        array of screen-space normalized Y coordinates of the line.

      • setPoints

        public void setPoints​(double[] xs,
                      double[] ys)
        Resets the data points and recalculates the min and max points. xs and ys must be same size arrays.
        Parameters:
        xs - absolute values of the X coordinates of the data points.
        ys - absolute values of the Y coordinates of the data points.
